channel.title: Will Microsoft ever make a new xbox?
channel.description: Is there any interviews/news articles/media hinting or stating that Microsoft will make a new Xbox product? Or have they already decided to end making gaming consoles at the Xbox 360?

item.title: Will Microsoft ever make a new xbox?
item.dc:creator: Hammich
item.description:
Microsoft makes their profit through software sales as being the publisher for series like FORZA, Halo, FABLE, Gears of War.etc as well as selling licencing rights and such. Intellectual property.

And this generation of consoles, I believe, are holding up quite well technologically. Not up to PC standard but they aren’t THAT far behind, remember what they pumped out of the original XBOX before the 360 superseded it… Black, Splinter Cell: Chaos Theory, Farcry: Instincts, DOOM3, Half-Life 2.etc…

looking at them, they certainly don’t seem impressive these days, but considering it was rendered on a 733Mhz Pentium 3, 64mb RAM shared with a GPU equivalent of a midrange GeForce 3 card and DirectX 8.1… and at the time, MINIMUM hardware requirements for equivalent PC games were more than 5 times the raw power of consoles, not counting new hardware tech… and that’s to run it on lowest settings with a barely acceptable framerate…

I think the current generation of consoles still have a lot of life left in them.
360 for example has a tri-core 3.2Ghz GPU, 512mbGDDR3 Ram shared with the GPU equivalent of a GeForce 7 card… You might sneer at those figures compared to your mighty PC setup, but developers have been known to pull seemingly impossible things out of console hardware in the past.

PC hardware power hasn’t been increasing at nearly the same rate now as it was 10 years ago and software has been becoming more efficient while catching up with the deeper capabilities of the hardware that supports it. Make no mistake, PC is the undisputed hardware king, but unless PC hardware takes a MAJOR turn in the next year or two, the current consoles will be able to hold their own for at least another couple of years, and microsoft WILL make another console.

Read full topic
item.source: Will Microsoft ever make a new xbox?

item.title: Will Microsoft ever make a new xbox?
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
No doubt.

loony636:

However, a big thing that Microsoft (and Sony) are going to have to overcome is the price of the hardware. Not specifically for consumers, but for themselves; at present, both Microsoft and Sony make a loss per unit of hardware they sell, but turn a profit on the games. If they ever want to release a new console and actually want to make considerable amounts of money out of it, they need to do a Nintendo and work out a way of turning a profit on the damn thing.

I know they lost money on me seeing how they gave me a new console because they couldn’t figure out how to fix the [COLOR=‘Red’]E65 ERROR.

According to the internets, E65 errors happen when you make hardware modifications to your system. I bought mine new, and never opened it up. I wouldn’t have the balls to open it up because I’m absolutely petrified that the console will fail on me. Guess what, it did!

Ah, I love my Wii. I’ve made hardware and software modifications to where the console is black, and I have the Homebrew Channel successfully running with emulators for the Atari 2600, NES, SNES, GEN, GBA, N64, and DOS. I also have running ports of the full versions of Wolfenstein 3D, Doom I & II, Quake, and Mahjong. I did all this, knowing full well, that Nintendo’s systems last, no matter what you put it through. Only 9% of Wiis purchased have had hardware failures. Microsoft has had nearly 90% in console failure rates. I believe that to be a problem. Hee.

To be honest, I am completely satisfied with my Wii, and none of you “Mature Only Hardcore Elitists” can convince me otherwise.

Read full topic

item.title: Will Microsoft ever make a new xbox?
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
Of course they’ll make a new Xbox. They’ll need a new platform to force people to buy it in order to play Halo 4.

In all seriousness though, they’ll definitely make a new Xbox. There’s no way they can just rest on their laurels with the 360, and technology will always be advancing, so eventually they’ll have to release a new one to avoid technological obsolete…ness, and a loss of market share if their competitors release a new one.

I heard a rumour of a new version of the Wii with super-mega-advanced hardware coming out some time in the future, but the article was very unclear as to when exactly that might be. If that happens, I’m sure we’ll see a new Xbox (and PS) competitor to, well, compete with them.

However, a big thing that Microsoft (and Sony) are going to have to overcome is the price of the hardware. Not specifically for consumers, but for themselves; at present, both Microsoft and Sony make a loss per unit of hardware they sell, but turn a profit on the games. If they ever want to release a new console and actually want to make considerable amounts of money out of it, they need to do a Nintendo and work out a way of turning a profit on the damn thing.

Read full topic
item.source: Will Microsoft ever make a new xbox?
